Job DescriptionOur talented Data Engineering team is made up of globally recognized experts - and there‚Äôs room for more analytical and ambitious data professionals. If you‚Äôre passionate about helping clients make better data-driven decisions to tackle their most complex business issues, let‚Äôs talk. Take your skills to a new level and launch a career where you can truly do what matters.Come and join us!As a member of the Data Engineering team, you‚Äôll have access to the research, knowledge, and tools to create leading-edge solutions across Avanade‚Äôs Business Intelligence practice. The role of Data Engineer is perfect for ambitious technologists passionate about working with the latest Microsoft cloud technology and Microsoft experts. Our clients look to us for innovation, which means you‚Äôll have early access to the newest Microsoft technologies so you can master them and stay ahead of the curve.Together we do what matters.What you'll do Translate business requirements to technical solutions leveraging strong business.  Analyze current business practices, processes and procedures as well as identifying future business opportunities for leveraging Microsoft Azure Data & Analytics PaaS Services.  Support the planning and implementation of data design services, providing sizing and configuration assistance and performing needs assessments.  Deliver of architectures for transformations and modernizations of enterprise data solutions using Azure cloud data technologies.  Design and Build Modern Data Pipelines and Data Streams.  Design and Build Data Service APIs.  Develop and maintain data warehouse schematics, layouts, architectures and relational/non-relational databases for data access and Advanced Analytics.  Expose data to end users using PowerBI, Azure API Apps or any other modern visualization platform or experience.  Implement effective metrics and monitoring processes. Skills And ExperiencesExisting experience in Data Engineering, ideally with large volumes of data at least 1 year. Experience in working with the latest Azure technologies, such as; Databricks, Synapse, Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Storage, Cosmos DBUnderstanding of software engineering tools and concepts including coding experience in languages such as Python, Scala, or SparkConfident communicator who is able to report progress and challenges effectivelyAbout YouCharacteristics that can spell success for this roleAnalytical, curious, agileTeam player and good communicatorProblem-solver, patient, quality-drivenSelf-motivatingInnovative mindset¬øWanna know more about us?üíª Collaborate with some of the brightest ‚ÄúMicrosoft minds‚Äùüå± Build your expertise, solve problems, learn, and developmentüíª Flexible scheduledüè† Possibility to work 100% remotelyüéâ Days off during Christmas and Easter.ü©∫ Medical insurance.üí∞ Variable and flexible remuneration.üå± Opportunity to work for Microsoft‚Äôs Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 years in a row), with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certificationsüè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà LGTBIQA+ Friendly EnvironmentIf you want to know more about our benefits, check this linkA great place to workAs you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you‚Äôll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and our communities. You‚Äôll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It‚Äôs all here, so take a closer look!We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. job_description:
The PositionDiabetes is a pesky monster ‚Äî and that‚Äôs putting it mildly. If you‚Äôre serious about helping us face it head-on, come join us!Being a global leader in integrated Personalized Diabetes Management (iPDM), Roche Diabetes Care collaborates with pioneers around the globe, including people with diabetes, caregivers, healthcare professionals, and payers. We aim to transform and advance care provision and foster sustainable care structures. Under the brands RocheDiabetes, Accu-Chek, and mySugr, comprising glucose monitoring, insulin delivery systems, and digital solutions, we unite with our partners to create patient-centered value. By building and collaborating in an open ecosystem, connecting devices, and digital solutions as well as contextualizing relevant data points, we aim to support the optimization of therapy and enable better-informed therapy decisions.For a behind-the-scenes look, check out our Roche code4life to see what makes Roche Diabetes Care tick: code4life.roche.com/Here‚Äôs What We‚Äôre Looking ForWe‚Äôre looking for an experienced Technical Lead in the Data Engineering domain. You will be responsible for the design and implementation of the data and analytics platform making data accessible for multiple purposes. Main purposes include insights generation, real world evidence, develop & train ML algorithms and to support data-driven decisions.Your Upcoming MissionLead the design and implementation of the data & analytics architecture ensuring compliance, quality and a sustainable growth of the platform. Build scalable data pipelines to integrate and model datasets from different sources that meet functional and non-functional requirements.Provide the technology, the tools and data to support data scientists and analysts in R&D, One Medical and Commercial teams. Manage the technical backlog on the Data & Analytics Platform.Ensure the data quality by implementing and monitoring a data quality framework together with the data source teams. Work with data infrastructure to triage infrastructure issues and drive to resolution.Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to understand their business needs. Formulate and complete end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables and presentations.Foster a data driven culture throughout the team and to lead data science projects that will have impact throughout the organization.Help to grow our data team with exceptional engineers.Essential Skills For This MissionBS degree Computer Science or related field8+ years relevant experience as Data Engineer, building Data Platforms, Datalakes and Business Intelligence solutionsProficient implementing data pipelines (using i.e. Pyspark, Spark SQL, Scala), orchestration tools/services (i.e. Airflow, data factory) and testing frameworks. Proficient with Software Engineering best practices, such as unit testing and integration testing, and software development tools, such as Intellij, Maven, Git, Docker among others.Experience in one of the main cloud services (AWS, Google Cloud or Azure) with Big Data services (EMR, Databricks, Synapse, HDInsight, Kinesis, etc.)Experience in databases (columnar, nosql and relational databases: Redshift, Dynamodb, Aurora, Postgres and/or Snowflake), data modeling and data management tools (Hive, Jupiter, Zeppelin and/or Databricks).Experience with orchestration, automation, integration and continuous delivery frameworks such as Jenkins or Streamsets.Experience with reporting systems and visualization tools Quicksight, Tableau and Looker.Experience working in Agile methodologies Bonus SkillsExperience with DevOps, DataOps and MLOps.Experience with security and privacy regulations (GDPR, HIPAA).Experience in Data Science and Machine LearningKnowledge on Data Mesh ArchitecturesKnowledge on the Health Industry.Here's What You Can Expect From UsWe are ambitious and passionate people building meaningful products.We actively promote personal and career development so if you like writing blog posts, contributing to open source projects, or are an active participant and/or speaker at conferences and meet-ups, we are here to support you.An innovative agile working environment allowing for collaboration and knowledge sharing in cross-functional teams.Hybrid home office/on-site working model. Loads of benefits (Apple hardware, lunch benefit, training, medical insurance, life insurance, stock options...)Oh, and did we mention the best team in the world!Location: This position can be based in Barcelona area or Vienna. Here at Roche Diabetes Care, we are committed to providing a healthy, equal, and inclusive working environment for our employees! We care about family-friendly career paths, sustainability, a healthy lifestyle, and the flexibility of a modern workplace. We maintain a culture of learning and sharing, as well as open and candid feedback. At every level, there are many opportunities to develop and grow at Roche Diabetes Care - both professionally and personally.Who we areAt Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we‚Äôve become one of the world‚Äôs leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Hi there üëãAs Factorial continues scaling our mission of boosting the next generation of people-first SMB‚Äôs, we‚Äôre hiring  Senior Data Engineers to scale our Engineering team.The TeamFactorial‚Äôs mission is to empower business make better decisions, and data is a key component in achieving so.Our Team is responsible of unlocking communication between the different areas despite the technological stack by offering a self service platform that allows fast data driven products.We act under the data mesh principle and we‚Äôre not afraid to build whatever is necessary to fulfil our neighbour team‚Äôs needs.Our data platform is already offering the following services:Ingestion (SaaS APIs - Airbyte, DDBBs - Debezium, Streams - Kafka Connect)Storage (Data Lake - Delta, Stream Storage- Kafka)Catalogue (Atlan)Modeling (Metabolic)Activation (Hightouch)Exploration & Visualization (Superset)On demand Data Products (TinyBird)We‚Äôre looking for Data Engineers to enable product and engineering teams use these and future services, and assist them in making data products a first class citizen.The RoleAt Factorial, we have a team of +150 very talented developers. We are looking for engineers who can wear many hats, abstract problems, and find creative solutions. We look for smart people who are curious, proactive and have good soft/communication skills.We are not looking for a long list of skills and technologies. Our web stack is Ruby on Rails for the backend and React/React-native for the clients, and we interact with Data through SQL on AWS, but it‚Äôs not mandatory to be proficient in those (most of the team came with other areas of expertise which is very enriching). We believe that someone who has good aptitudes and is hungry for learning is what works best.If you‚Äôre looking for new challenges in a people-first company without depending on where you live, this is what to expect: You will evangelise the use of our Data Platform among technical users and empower the creation of Factorial's next Data Products.  You will listen, identify and evaluate new requirements from Stakeholders (Engineering, Product, Management, Sales, Customer Experience, Marketing, Growth).  You will iterate and improve existing features of our platform as well as develop new ones.  You will occasionally assist Data Analysts with their technical challenges.  You will occasionally contribute in managing the platform from a DataOps point of view. Your profile You are a team player: You are comfortable helping your teammates, sharing your knowledge, reviewing their code and asking for reviews of your own.  You have a user-centric mindset: You know that the only reason we write code is to help the users of Factorial to perform their tasks.  You like relaxed and fun environments: We work hard and we are committed to Factorial users but we do that in a fun and relaxed atmosphere. We don't take ourselves too much seriously.  You are a learner: You want to improve your skills not only in the engineering field but across any other areas.  You are an owner: You like proposing new hypotheses and be responsible for building, deploying and validating them.  You love understanding: Breaking down complex problems into basic and shareable elements and you have evolved concrete implementations to abstractions before.  You are a polyglot developer: You have experience in several coding languages, CI/CD tools and cloud technologies.  You are a mentor: You love to share your experience and expertise to help others grow.  You are comfortable communicating in English. Your backgroundExperience in building a modern Data Platform. Functional programming in Scala (or any other JVM language).  Spark development, especially Structured Streaming, or equivalent (Flink, Beam, Samza,...) Nice-to-havesKnowledge of the AWS Analytics Stack (Glue, S3, Athena, Redshift, Kinesis, Lake Formation)Advanced Analytical SQL knowledge.Some alternative coding experience, ideally with a background of web development.Some alternative infrastructure experience, ideally in Kubernetes.Some infrastructure as code experience, ideally with Terraform on Cloud.GitOps driven mentality and data CI/CD ideas.At Factorial we don't evaluate you by the years of experience you have, we evaluate your knowledge and skills. How? We have a Career Path with a rubric framework where we define what is expected for each experience level and skill. This framework allows you to know at which level you're right now and what you need to keep growing. As we love transparency, our Career Path includes the salaries for each level and we share it during the first interview to make sure we're aligned.For this senior-level position, the annual gross salary is 60,000‚Ç¨ regardless of your location. This includes a base salary of 51,000‚Ç¨ and a variable pay of up to 9,000‚Ç¨ anualy and paid monthly, depending on the company's goals.To wrap up:We're looking for a Scala Data Engineers with Spark Streaming and Kafka experience.60.000‚Ç¨ Salary ( Senior) + ESOP plan. 1.000‚Ç¨ of annual Learning and Development budget.A safe and diverse environment to grow and make an impact.And when at the office: Syra discounts Breakfast and organic fruit Free caffeine and theine Pet-Friendly work environmentIs this you?! Come rock the world with us! üöÄ We #betonpeople üíúAbout Factorial HR ü§ìFactorial is an company management software fast-growing startup founded in 2016. Our mission is to help companies automate HR workflows, centralise people data and make better business decisions. We currently serve thousands of customers in over 60 countries all over the world and across industries. We‚Äôve built a super diverse and multicultural team of over +700 people in Barcelona, Brazil, Mexico and EEUU offices, in addition to the 150+ engineering team that is spread across the globe.Do you want to know more about us? We've won awards and received outstanding customer feedback since day one. We‚Äôve recently raised 120M‚Ç¨ in our series C funding, bringing us to unicorn valuation with top international venture capital firms (Atomico, Tiger, CRV, Creandum, K Fund to name a few).

Gracias al boom de la anal√≠tica, estamos en un ritmo constante de crecimiento, y desde 1994 nos hemos convertido en el socio de confianza para empresas que desean maximizar todo el potencial de sus datos.Si buscas formar parte de una compa√±√≠a 100% especializada en #Data & #Analytics, ¬°te estamos esperando!Requisitos m√≠nimos:Estar graduado en Ingenier√≠a Inform√°tica o de Telecomunicaciones.Tener al menos 4 a√±os de experiencia en un rol de Big Data Engineer, implementando y productivizando soluciones de captaci√≥n, ingesta y transformaci√≥n de datos con herramientas de procesamiento distribuido y/o procesamiento en streaming.Experiencia en arquitectura de datos (formato, estructura, particionado, modelado, capas y ciclo de vida) en ambientes Data Lake, Data Lakehouse, Kafka Topics & Partitioning, Schema Registry, etc.Adem√°s ser√° importante que tengas experiencia en algunas de las siguientes herramientas:Lenguajes: Python, Java o Scala.Herramientas core del entorno de procesamiento en entornos Big Data, especialmente Apache Spark. Requisitos valorables:Nos gusta estar al d√≠a en nuevas tecnolog√≠as, as√≠ que necesitamos personas que quieran estar en continua evoluci√≥n y que tengan ganas de aprender nuevas tecnolog√≠as y probar nuevas herramientas.Para nosotrxs el trabajo en equipo es primordial, por lo que buscamos personas que impulsen ese buen ambiente y las sinergias entre compa√±erxs y diferentes equipos de trabajo.Qu√© conozcas lenguajes que est√°n tomando relevancia ahora en el mundo data como Rust o Elixir es algo que valoraremos muy positivamente tambi√©n.C√≥mo trabajamos en un entorno global, ser√° un plus que puedas comunicarte en ingl√©s.Conocimiento sobre DataOps, Observabilidad, patrones de dise√±o low-code/no-code,... About RevolutPeople deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesoÔªøme products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 35+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.ÔªøÔªøAs we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. We've been officially certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢ in recognition of our outstanding employee experience! So far, we have 8,000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.About The RoleOur Technology team isn‚Äôt just one of the best in the industry, it‚Äôs one of the best in the world. And we‚Äôre proud of it. It‚Äôs our driving force; our engine üöÄFrom building a new banking backend to creating an award-winning app, there‚Äôs nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can‚Äôt do.Our Technology team isn‚Äôt here to fix legacy systems ‚Äì it‚Äôs here to build world-class financial products from the ground up.Products that will be used by millions of people around the world üåéYou may expect our Python Engineers to work on heavily regulated banking systems, but we love the unexpected.We‚Äôre actually better known internally for writing high-quality code and building complex novel solutions end-to-end üß†These geniuses have created our chatbot ‚Äì the lovely Rita ‚Äì and they didn‚Äôt stop there ü§ØThey‚Äôve also created automated FinCrime quality controls in a few weeks. Yes, they‚Äôre just that good!You‚Äôll never work alone, either. As a Python Engineer, you‚Äôll sit within a Product Team ‚Äì simultaneously working with Data Scientists, Analysts, Engineers, Product Owners and Operations Managers to solve problems and make our rocket ship fly even higher üöÄReady to join? üëáWhat You‚Äôll Be DoingBuilding APIs making sure they are properly designed and scale according to the business needsCreating data pipelines to pull data from production services into our data warehouse - powering reporting, data analytics and data scienceWriting event consumers to build new data models in order to provide this data to new flows and processesWhat You'll Need5+ years of experience working as a Software Engineer3+ years Engineering with Python as your primary languageAn academic background in a STEM subjectFluency in Python, SQL and other OOPLsExperience with API development & integrationPractical understanding of distributed systemsAbility to write concurrent code in IO/CPU bound situationsExperience with Docker, K8s, Ansible, Teamcity, monitoring and alertingNice to haveExperience with prototyping and sketchingMultiple side projects or open source contributionsExposure to GCPExperience with Django FrameworkBuilding a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

job_description:
We are TravelPerk: a scaling unicorn valued at $1.3billion that has raised over $400m since our creation in 2015.Backed by world-class investors with portfolios including AirBnb, Stripe, Slack, Trello, Gusto, Twitter, Farfetch and Deliveroo, our team is made up of A-players from across the travel and technology industries.Over the past few years, we‚Äôve been named the fastest-growing SaaS startup in the world by SaaS1000 and featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both Forbes and Wired. We‚Äôre revolutionizing the B2B corporate travel market‚Äîworth over $1.3 trillion‚Äî to connect people in real life in an enjoyable and sustainable way.TravelPerk are innovators. During the last year we have welcomed and acquired the likes of Click Travel, NexTravel and Albatross to the team. From TravelCare, to FlexiPerk and of course GreenPerk we are shaping the future of the industry. Our team continues to emerge stronger and stronger as we adjust to the new normal‚Äîand that‚Äôs where you come in!If you‚Äôre ready to take off with us, keep reading!If you‚Äôre ready to take off with us, keep reading!We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team. You will be managing and analyzing all data being processed at TravelPerk in order to create useful insights for strategic purposes. This is an instrumental position to bring the business to the next level, as you will support Product owners, Marketing, and Management with visual data analysis to facilitate conversations and assist in data-driven decision making. Are you ready to take off with us? Keep reading!What You Will DoDevelop quantitative analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategyQuery datasets from different sources, turn data into information, information into insight and insight into product and business decisionsUse data to investigate and help resolve issues in our product or processesDesign and implement metrics, dashboards, and reportsApply visualization techniques to facilitate conversations and assist in decision makingSupport Product owners, Marketing, and Management with visual data analysis to facilitate conversations and assist in decision makingWhat You Need3-4 years of relevant experience interpreting data in a business intelligence, analytics, or data science/data scientist role, including relevant tools, techniques, and technologyExcellent communication skills, both written and spoken, in EnglishExcellent analytical skillsYou Will Need To Prove The FollowingYou are a Master in data analysis tools (SQL, Google Analytics, and excel)Experience with statistical packages (Python, R)Comfortable querying different type of databases (ie PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch)Experience preparing, consolidating and normalizing dataExperience with different data visualization and BI tools (ie Tableau, Looker)The desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction, and with highly engaged individualsWhat do we offer?Competitive compensation including equity in the companyGenerous vacation days so you can rest and rechargeHealth perks such as private healthcare or gym allowance depending on your location"Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salaryUnforgettable TravelPerk events including to travel to one of our hubsMental health support tool for your wellbeingExponential growth opportunitiesOur Vision is for a world where TravelPerk serves as the platform for human connection in-real-life (IRL). We take an IRL-first approach to work, where our team works together in-person 3 days a week. As such, this role requires you to be based within commuting distance of our Barcelona hub. We fundamentally believe in the value of meeting in-real-life to improve connectivity, productivity, creativity and ultimately making us a great place to work.For certain roles, we can help with relocation from anywhere in the world, English is the official language at the office. Please submit your resume in English if you choose to apply. Do not forget to submit an updated portfolio and/or resume.TravelPerk is a global company with a diverse customer base‚Äîand we want to make sure the people behind our product reflect that. We‚Äôre an equal opportunity employer, which means you‚Äôre welcome at TravelPerk regardless of how you look, where you‚Äôre from, or anything else that makes you, well, you.

With 90 million active users and half a billion total downloads, Bending Spoons is one of Europe‚Äôs leading app developers. But we won‚Äôt rest on our laurels: Our sights are set on becoming the world‚Äôs best. That‚Äôs where you come in. Our bright, innovative, and collaborative software engineers are at the core of our ambitious mission‚Äîand we‚Äôre always seeking to add exceptional junior engineers to our team.We‚Äôre searching for stand-out candidates who want to work in‚Äîand learn tons about‚Äîone of the following fields:AI software engineeringBackend software engineeringData engineeringInfrastructure engineeringMobile software engineeringSecurity & privacy engineeringWeb software engineeringDon‚Äôt worry if you‚Äôre not sure what area you‚Äôd like to work in just yet: We can take the time to chat about your interests and work out what‚Äôs likely to be the best fit for you. And when you apply for a job at Bending Spoons, we consider you for every suitable open position.A few examples of your responsibilities:Work closely with other software engineers to expand our set of libraries and make our processes ever-more efficient.Learn about the latest and greatest technologies, testing the promising ones to make sure we don‚Äôt miss out on game-changing opportunities to boost our productivity and the enjoyment of our work.Constantly improve the quality of our products, tools, or infrastructures by fixing bugs and refactoring the code base where necessary.Contribute to product development and product roadmap planning. Take a proactive role and ownership of the products you work on.What we look forLogical-analytical abilities. You‚Äôre able to objectively evaluate complex information, arguments, and situations. You‚Äôre used to applying logical deduction to tackle sophisticated problems, and this has often allowed you to solve difficult intellectual challenges.Drive. Your dedication matches the intensity of your ambition. You‚Äôre willing to put in the hard work necessary to achieve your goals, and the highly demanding challenges in your track record are proof of your relentless spirit.Passion. You have a genuine love for the field. You investigate the subject extensively and are always up to date with the latest developments.Organization and structure. You‚Äôre meticulously organized and superbly structured, so you can handle multiple tasks and responsibilities with poise and precision.Indisputable excellence. Your academic or professional career is marked by a series of remarkable accomplishments. You have habitually achieved superior outcomes in your chosen fields and are continually seeking ways to outperform the expectations set for you.Pragmatism. Far from being too academic or obsessive in your perfectionism, you understand that speed is often as important as quality when getting things done in a competitive world.Curiosity and initiative. Rather than waiting to be told what to do, you‚Äôre forever hunting down new opportunities and testing fresh ideas. You‚Äôve consistently and actively participated in independent projects, and you‚Äôre an endless source of innovative ideas.A collaborative nature. You can understand others and work well with them, balancing patience and assertiveness.Willingness to learn. We use Python for backend, and Swift and Kotlin for mobile. But it's not a problem if you have little or no experience with them, as long as you‚Äôre enthusiastic about learning. We‚Äôd be happy to teach you!Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.What we offerReal impact. We automate most menial tasks, freeing you up to focus your expertise where it can make the biggest impact.Talented, knowledgeable colleagues. Learn from (and teach) some of the brightest and most skilled people you‚Äôll ever meet. Your talent is going to blossom here.Flexibility and trust. From day one, you‚Äôll be one of the team and fully trusted. No micromanagement or clipping your wings‚Äîjust the freedom and responsibility to do great work.Continuous education. Spooners get unlimited backing for learning investments, including Italian or English lessons and things like courses, conferences, and books. There‚Äôs no permission or approval process‚Äîyou‚Äôre fully trusted to use the company‚Äôs resources efficiently.Flexible schedule. Our regular hours are 9-6 GMT+1, with remote work allowed within GMT-2 to GMT+3 time zones.People who lift up one another. We hire for talent and leave the ego at the door. You'll find a group of truly talented Spooners who are eager to teach their secrets and to learn. Reciprocal support and respect is everything‚Äîyou‚Äôre unlikely to ever encounter a more harmonious crew.The finest tools. You get the best hardware on the market and all the software you could need. We can't wait to introduce you to our high-tech approach and our cutting-edge workflows.Relocation package. If you need to relocate for the position, we typically cover reasonable transportation and moving expenses, provide up to three months of temporary accommodation, and help you and your close family members with visa support if necessary.Remote working. Spend as much or as little time in our Milan office as you choose. Many Spooners like to change up their environment and get out of the city whenever the mood strikes. You‚Äôve always got the freedom to decide where today‚Äôs office is.Competitive salary and stock options. Our compensation packages are designed to attract and retain the best talent in the industry. Individuals just starting their career joining on a full-time contract are offered a salary of ‚Ç¨63,965 along with a ‚Ç¨1,200 welfare bonus. If you already have a few years of relevant work experience, you can expect to earn between ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330, depending on your expertise. As you gain experience and increase your impact, compensation can grow rapidly. You also have the option to receive some of your pay in company ownership (equity) at a discounted rate.Commitment & contractPermanent or fixed-term. Full-time.LocationMilan (Italy) or fully remote.Before you applyThanks for taking the time to read this far. We‚Äôd be delighted if you decide to apply, but ask that you first consider the following:Bending Spoons is an extremely demanding environment. We‚Äôre highly ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and our teammates, so you‚Äôre likely to work harder here than at most companies, and to regularly push yourself beyond your comfort zone. While this tends to drive tremendous learning and lead to fantastic achievements, it can also be stressful.We‚Äôre uncompromising on our standard of excellence. The vast majority of Spooners stay for years and have amazing careers here. However, it can also happen that an individual doesn‚Äôt contribute at the rate we look for. In such cases, we support the Spooner in their efforts to make the necessary improvements, but will counsel them to leave if they don‚Äôt manage to do so.We're proud of the company we've built, and many of us can't imagine working anywhere else. Still, we understand that a career at Bending Spoons isn't for everybody. We hope what you‚Äôve read here helps you determine whether it might be the place for you. If you believe it is, then we encourage you to apply‚Äîand perhaps discover what you‚Äôre truly capable of!The selection processIf you successfully pass through our screening process, we‚Äôll invite you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach and solve unfamiliar problems. If you‚Äôre successful there, we‚Äôll invite you to take part in some interviews. We welcome applications in English and Italian.Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment all applicants and we provide reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, we look for talent and potential‚Äînot just experience and expertise. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it, go ahead and apply.

job_description:
We‚Äôre looking for a product-oriented Software Engineer that enjoys taking ownership of complex problems with a big scope, and working with the end customer as well as the rest of the engineering team to design and implement the best solution. We have a lean working environment with few meetings, focused on having a lot of delivery & interaction with the direct users of the product (mainly our internal account managers as well as the end customers). Engineers at Aldara have a lot of freedom to work on multiple challenges end-to-end, while at the same time forming part of a team with high standards for system architecture, code quality and product usability that fosters great work.Engineering @ AldaraHere are the core traits that define how the tech team works at Aldara.Lean engineering. Own the problem end-to-endWe don‚Äôt have Product Managers, Agile Coaches or Scrum Masters. We trust our engineers to be able to understand the problems at hand, devise the best solution, share it with others and own the implementation from start to finish. The engineers who excel at Aldara are those that take pleasure in mastering all parts of the stack, from database modeling to UX design, to bring together a fully functional feature. The only big meetings we really have are the biweekly Demos, where engineers come together to share & showcase the latest changes to the rest of the company.Horizontal structure with few but high quality contributorsYou‚Äôll be reporting directly to the CTO, while interacting heavily with Operations and Account Management to get the feedback cycle working. We don‚Äôt have teams in engineering, and we want to keep it that way as long as we can by hiring few but very high quality individual contributors. As an engineer, you‚Äôll be deeply integrated with the rest of the team, working often with the internal stakeholders as well as the end customer. You will also be working closely with our providers, from local ones to big corps, as we develop our relationships with them as an additional player in our ecosystem. We believe a horizontal structure with a high motivation for debate brings forward the best product choices.Focus on building great, scalable software, with rock-solid architecture to deploy itOur stack is simple: Postgres, Django, React, Terraform, and AWS are the main pieces, with Datadog to keep track of it all. We care a lot about our developer UX and setup to make developers have the easiest time adding a new feature, testing it thoroughly and deploying it in the same beat. We‚Äôve got 95% testing coverage checked on every PR, one-click deployments happening constantly and a carefully thought out code structure that focuses on modular software that can be easily reused. Our local setup replicates the production environment to a tee. Develop locally and instantly debug your traces using Datadog, comparing against production traces.Freedom to explore and have fun, creativity is our best tool to engineer the future we wantWe don‚Äôt shy away from investing time in trying out new approaches to problems we need to solve. There‚Äôs offsite weeks when we go hack on something for a few days in an amazing venue with full focus. Regular hackathons where the whole team reconfigures into small pods that build something fun for a day or two. We want to foster your curiosity, allow you to explore and find new and better ways to solve problems. We believe the future of our space includes way more automation, AI, and inference than it does now, and we‚Äôll only get there by allowing you to be as creative as possible.The product you‚Äôll work onOur current product has three parts: the internal software we use to manage properties, the consumer experience we offer to property owners, and the provider management platform.Our internal software is the operating system of property management, used by our team of account managers to deliver an 11-star experience to our customers. This includes the streamlining of all aspects of building management: accounting, incident management, customer communications, taxes, utility management, insurance claims, etc.This is coupled with an intuitive consumer experience, catering to a very diverse set of property owners. From the old grandparents to the star-eyed couple who just bought a flat. Our product has to be inclusive to all walks of life and offer the best service possible. It includes a digital application as well as traditional communication methods (in-person and over the phone).Our provider platform allows our collaborators to interact with us in an easy and scalable way, and be motivated to work with us as much as possible. It will also give us an easy and structured way to have access to and discoverability of the best providers that can cover each of our customer‚Äôs needs.Preferred Skills And ExperienceWorking experience across the stack. Ideally you‚Äôre someone familiar with our specific stack already (Postgres, Django, React) but this is not a hard requirement. We prioritize people who are good across the board rather than having deep experience with specific libraries.Strong ownership culture, you‚Äôre someone that enjoys owning big parts of the product and caring for them in all their facets.A hands-on attitude and willingness to spend the necessary time researching, analyzing, and identifying the problem to make decisions with as much data as possible to back them up.An open-minded approach to software development, with the ability to debate different trade-offs with strong yet highly rational arguments that prioritize what‚Äôs best for the project.A high level of proactivity and curiosity, we are looking for developers who are excited about problem-solving, thinking creatively comes to them naturally.Ability to work from our Barcelona office daily, with the option to work remotely occasionally if the need arises. We‚Äôre at the stage of the company where most of the interactions happen in-person, and we plan to keep it that way for the short and medium term.Proficiency in Spanish is highly desirable, though not a requirement. ## Perksüìú Have a go at changing an antiquated industry - opportunities to combine technology and operations to improve old, massive industries don‚Äôt happen every day. Be on the team tackling the challenges head-on, challenging the status quo and inventing ways to solve old problems.üìà Stock Options - we would only imagine you joining us if you have skin in the game. For us, this means owning a piece of the company and sharing in the upside if we succeed.‚≠êÔ∏è Work with a small team of bright people - we are strong believers in small but high impact teams. Expect to work with really talented colleagues with experience in top tech companies and multiple time founders. We keep a high quality bar and pride ourselves for our good work.ü§ù Company culture built on trust and transparency - we expect you to speak up and share your feedback openly, in turn we are completely open about our feedback and company direction.üè¢ In-person - we believe nothing beats being in the same room and spending time together. From deep working sessions to spending quality time off-work.ü§© Beautiful office - our office is in one of the prime locations in Barcelona (Passeig de Gr√†cia), with direct view‚Äôs to Gaudi‚Äôs La Pedrera, and a large terrace where we organize events for our family, friends, and colleagues. Expect beautiful sunsets and easy access to the whole city.üë©‚Äçüé® Shape the culture - by joining so early in the team, we expect you to have a say in the future of the company, including ways of working, culture and direction. You‚Äôll not only have a front row seat, but actively participate in developing the playbook that gets us to succeed.

We are TravelPerk: a scaling unicorn valued at $1.3billion that has raised over $400m since our creation in 2015.Backed by world-class investors with portfolios including AirBnb, Stripe, Slack, Trello, Gusto, Twitter, Farfetch and Deliveroo, our team is made up of A-players from across the travel and technology industries.Over the past few years, we‚Äôve been named the fastest-growing SaaS startup in the world by SaaS1000 and featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both Forbes and Wired. We‚Äôre revolutionizing the B2B corporate travel market‚Äîworth over $1.3 trillion‚Äî to connect people in real life in an enjoyable and sustainable way.TravelPerk are innovators. During the last year we have welcomed and acquired the likes of Click Travel, NexTravel and Albatross to the team. From TravelCare, to FlexiPerk and of course GreenPerk we are shaping the future of the industry. Our team continues to emerge stronger and stronger as we adjust to the new normal‚Äîand that‚Äôs where you come in!If you‚Äôre ready to take off with us, keep reading!Are you a Software Engineer with extensive programming experience? We‚Äôre not looking for stack experts. We‚Äôre looking for smart people who can bring in the best tools and processes to get the job done. Read more about our engineering team in this blog postYou will work on a day-to-day basis with our product team to design, architect and implement our product. TravelPerk is a next-generation platform to take the pain out of booking and managing business travel.As Software Engineer, This Position InvolvesProduct development in Python/Django and/or React of a travel-related web-based productIntegrations between our product to 3rd party APIsSystem architecture design, implementation, and testingWork in an Agile environment with strong attention to a well-documented code, unit testing, and continuous integrationBeing able to mentor, coach, and train other colleagues as a domain expertRequired Skills And Experience"Product Engineering" mindsetPragmatism and obsession for simplicity, efficiency, and performanceExtensive experience in similar roles building technically complex products in any web programming languageAn expert level at server-side, client-side or full stack development. Your final role within the team will depend on your skills and internal training will be providedObsession for quality and testingEager to learn new technologies and frameworksStrong communication skillsBonus Points ForExperience in the travel industryDevOps experience with the AWS suiteExperience working with high-performing, Agile development teamsPeople who like to build stuff (we really like people who maintain/contribute to open source projects)What do we offer?Competitive compensation including equity in the companyGenerous vacation days so you can rest and recharge Health perks such as private healthcare or gym allowance depending on your location"Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salaryUnforgettable TravelPerk events including to travel to one of our hubsMental health support tools for your wellbeing Exponential growth opportunities Our Vision is for a world where TravelPerk serves as the platform for human connection in-real-life (IRL). We take an IRL-first approach to work, where our team works together in-person 3 days a week. As such, this role requires you to be based within commuting distance of our Barcelona hub. We fundamentally believe in the value of meeting in-real-life to improve connectivity, productivity, creativity and ultimately making us a great place to work.At TravelPerk, we prioritise experience and potential over academic qualifications for this role. We believe that talent and ability aren't always reflected in formal credentials.For certain roles, we provide relocation assistance. Please specify your need for this in your application, and we will evaluate the possibility on a case-by-case basis. English is our official office language, so we request that resumes be submitted in English for effective communication.TravelPerk is a global company with a diverse customer base, and we want to ensure the people behind our product reflect that. We‚Äôre an equal opportunity employer, meaning you‚Äôre welcome at TravelPerk regardless of your appearance, where you‚Äôre from, or anything else that makes you.

job_description:
We are ODILO: a fast-growing edtech company with a mission to democratize access to high-quality education and provide educational technology solutions to help our users reach their full potential.Through our solutions, we integrate access to millions of digital content items from the world's best providers and, using educational technology and Artificial Intelligence, enable any organization to create its own unlimited learning ecosystem.Currently, more than 8,000 institutions (governments, schools, libraries, universities, companies and startups) place their trust in Odilo, providing access to the benefits we offer to more than 170 million users in over 50 countries.Our team is truly international (19+ nationalities) with the best talent across the education, media, content, and technology sectors.In ODILO's strategic roadmap, data has become a key component to foster business growth. Data allows ODILO‚Äôs teams to better understand the users' learning needs, to offer them more appropriate content, to implement coaching and reinforcement strategies for those users who need a boost, etc. To address these challenges, ODILO's Data function has decided to reinforce key positions within the team.As a Data Engineer, you will report to the Data Director and work closely with all other business and product areas in ODILO to provide them with insightful information and reports. You will also be involved in interactions with the DevOps team to ensure that all data procedures meet defined security and integrity criteria.As a Data Engineer you must be proactive, willing to learn and adapt to the different challenges that arise on a daily basis. It is also essential that you understand the work environment as a collaboration between team members and not as individual silos. Technically you must be able to work with our AWS environment, building efficient and secure procedures to extract data from sources, transform and sort it for easy consumption. The differentiating value in the Data Engineer role will be to implement the best possible procedures while minimizing the use of resources.By working at ODILO you will have the opportunity to access our unlimited learning ecosystem. This combined with the culture of continuous learning by doing, allows employees to be in a very advantageous position to achieve all their professional and personal goals.What You Will Do At ODILOCollect and manage data from different sources in our AWS environment.Transform and load data with SQL, Python, Spark and Athena.Own and improve ODILO‚Äôs data environment.Interact with ODILO‚Äôs product areas to translate their information needs into data procedures.Collaborate with ODILO‚Äôs DevOps team to ensure that all data procedures meet defined security and integrity criteria.The ideal candidate will bring:Excellent Python/Spark skills and code documentation.Good SQL and relational database management skills.Excellent understanding of data extraction and transformation processes.Experience in the implementation of efficient data processes.Experience in using version control services (CodeCommit, Git).At least 2-3 years working as a Data Engineer.Fluent English, spoken and written.What would make us happy:Experience in managing and exploiting AWS environments (Glue, Athena, Lamda, Step Functions).Experience visualization and reporting tools (Quicksight, Power BI, Tableau)Experience in managing large datasets and implementing efficient processes for their computation.Why ODILO?Working at Odilo is about being part of a lifelong learning culture, where everyone has the possibility to take on challenges and participate in the growth of the company.But we also offer: A fast moving and challenging job within a mission driven company in an international, creative, and ambitious work environment.Unlimited learning with Odilofy, our platform with more than 3 million contents in all formats (books, audiobooks, learning experiences, movies, courses...).Emotional wellbeing services: psychologist and emotional wellbeing app.Possibility of team sports activities.Flexible Compensation Plans: Food, Transportation, Childcare, Training and Health insurance. A salary commensurate with track record and experience.Real opportunities for internal professional development.‚Ä¶And more!Sounds like a mission made for you? Then we need to talk!ODILO es una entidad comprometida con la Diversidad e Inclusi√≥n, por lo que acepta la presentaci√≥n de candidaturas sin sesgos.ODILO is an entity committed to Diversity and Inclusion, which is why it accepts the presentation of candidatures without bias.

With a end-to-end approach, we seamlessly navigate the entire service cycle, from meticulous validation and ongoing maintenance to effective obsolescence management.Here you will find more information about GTD Group: https://vimeo.com/149636682The role:GTD Science, Infrastructures & Robotics offers services and solutions for energy operators, and nuclear research centers focused on the development of robotics, control, and supervisors. We develop and validate ground-breaking smart infrastructure solutions and put some pretty nifty smart solutions on the market.We are looking for a Software Engineer to join GTD Science, Infrastructures & Robotics¬∏ the company of GTD Group specialized in the design and development of large, complex and/or safety-critical applications. Here you will find more information about us: https://vimeo.com/418046136Position activities:The selected person will participate in projects related to renewable energies.Containerization of services in Docker and deployment and maintenance of these.Design, implement and put into production scripts for data processing and machine learning.Design, implement and put into production data analysis and visualization tools.Design, implement and put into production CI/CD mechanisms. Your profile:Solid experiencie in programming languages mainly C++ and PythonKnowledge in the following programming languages: Java, Typescript, Go, RustAdvanced knowledge of operating systems (Linux, Windows)Experience in Jira, Confluence, Git, JenkinsKnowledge in Docker, Docker Swarm, Kubernetes or similarAdvanced knowledge in relational and non-relational databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB or similar)Experience with data monitoring and analysis tools (Grafana or similar)Knowledge of Big Data tools and parallel data processing (Kafka, Spark)Knowledge of Machine Learning tools (scikit-learn, opencv, Tensor Flow, PyTorch).Knowledge of frontend frameworks (React, Web components)Nice-to-have:EnglishSpanishWhat do we offer?Full-time position with a permanent contractTo participate in highly advanced technological projects all around the world.To be part of a young dynamic companyFlexible working hours.Excellent location in our BCN HQWork from home‚Äô policyTicket RestaurantFree fruit at work on WednesdaysTraining planFlexible Compensation Plan according to your needsWe are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, etc

At Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That‚Äôs why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.Meet the team!Do you love data? Do you want to work with a modern data stack using Snowflake, Airflow, Looker, Databricks, MonteCarlo and learn about these tools or participate in choosing the next ones? Do you love SQL? Do you love transforming and orchestrating data? Do you believe the data team should adopt version control, data testing and data governance processes?As part of the Data Strategy team, you‚Äôll participate in critical data model decisions, impacting and driving projects across our entire data stack, from collection/ingestion to processing and modeling with the aim of empowering our people to inform their decisions with quality data.At Preply, we are constantly running hundreds of AB tests, each with specific tracking and analytic requirements. This, along with the wide scope of our product and the sophistication of the tutor/learner interactions, makes for some rewarding challenges.What You‚Äôll Be DoingScale and evolve our data model optimizing for simplicity, accessibility, performance, scalability and reliability. Ensure a smooth and organic growth of our data models;Design and implement diverse strategies to meet existing requirements while anticipating the future needs of our internal clients;Build and optimize ETL processes for the core data model, integrating additional data sources as needed;Build up and optimize our data model into our BI Tool (Looker via LookML) including creating and maintaining data sources, custom metrics and dashboards. Contribute towards the strategy and design of self service analytics reporting;Optimize data ingestion and transformation in our multi-terabyte data lake and data warehouse platform;Act as a referent for our Data Scientists, providing guidance and expertise as they build and produce their data pipelines, minimizing redundancies, inefficiencies and technical debt;Work closely with data analysts, data scientists and backend engineers to understand business requirements and provide data ready for analysis.Apply software engineering best practices like version control and continuous integration to the analytics code base. Select and instrument data quality tools and processes;What You Need To Succeed5+ years of experience in a similar role;Bachelors or Masters Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or similar fields;Strong coding skills in one or more languages (SQL, Python, etc.);Experience with high-volume tracking events ingestion and processing;Experience with data transformation frameworks/tools, particularly with DBT;Prior experience modeling data into BI tools (preferably in Looker, via LookML);A rare combination of technical skills, business mindset and communication skills, able to persuade and influence data product stakeholders;Strong curiosity, problem-finding and problem-solving skills;Creative mindset and a proactive attitude towards the creation and evaluation of new solutions;Good written and verbal communication skills. B2 English is a must;Nice To HavePrevious experience scaling start-ups infrastructure;Experience developing critical data processes to standardized definition of KPIs and taxonomy of events across medium/big organizations;Knowledge of coordination tools (Airflow, Luigi, Jenkins, etc.);Working experience with the AWS stack/Google Cloud Platform.Why You‚Äôll Love It At PreplyAn open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;Access to free mental health support platforms;Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;Not in Barcelona? We offer an attractive relocation package to join us in our Preply Barcelona Hub;The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).Our PrinciplesCare to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don‚Äôt fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress. Diversity, Equity, and InclusionPreply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

TUI Group is the world‚Äôs number one integrated tourism business. CVM technology analytics is a team responsible for ingesting, modelling and extracting data in the TUI Central Region for CRM purposes. We are a multi-disciplinary team of experts across Architecture, Engineering, DevOps and Agile Delivery providing services across the UK, Ireland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Germany, Belgium and The Netherlands.At TUI we‚Äôre ambitious to become the leader in technology within the travel industry and to achieve this we are looking to build a capable, creative team who want to be a part of accomplishing that goal.We never stop looking ahead, seeking new ways to delight our customers and grow our business. We recognise the power of digital and the massive contribution this brings to creating a truly unique and differentiated customer experience.We are looking for a talented and dedicated technical enthusiast to join the Analytics Master Domain organisation which provides state of the art data products. ABOUT THE JOB:As a Data Engineer, you will be part of a cross-functional team that enables data engineering skills and capabilities across a whole domain. Being an enthusiast in data engineering, with a strong DevSecOps mindset, you‚Äôll use your excellent collaboration skills to work with your team to deliver the best answers to our customers‚Äô needs with full responsibility for its data flows from design to operation. You will use your deep technical skills to work closely with your colleagues to ensure an optimal data delivery architecture which is consistent throughout ongoing projects. You will work on data collection, data pipelines, data delivery to other systems and building a strong core data warehouse. You will Support your fellow Data Analysts and Data Scientists on data engineering tasks and work as a team to deliver data driven solutions.You will Build and maintain data processing systems, including data ingestion, data quality control, and data warehousing.In addition to ensuring operational and analytical excellence you will be working on connecting on-premise data with cloud computingPerform root cause analysis to identify and resolve data quality issues.Demonstrate meticulous attention to detail in ensuring the quality of your work, encompassing comprehensive documentation and stringent security measures.ABOUT YOU:Work experience as a Data Engineer or similarStrong SQL and data profiling skills ‚Äì enjoy working with data, process analytics and development, understanding of common architectures. Experience in data modelling with ETL (e.g., usage of Informatica) and scheduling (e.g., UC4, airflow).Knowledge of BI applications such as Power BI, Tableau or Spotfire.Able to work with GitLab or similar tools for code management.Preferred experience with AWS and SnowflakePreferred experience with Big Data projectsGood communications and influencing skills, with the ability to explain technologies and solutions to technical and non-technical stakeholdersCritical thinker and able to provide constructive feedbackBachelor‚Äôs Degree or equivalent in Computer Engineering or similarExperience in the Tourism Industry is a plusFluent in written and spoken English, German skills is a plus.About Our OfferWorking in the leading global tourism group: We stand for intercultural cooperation and offer the opportunity to work in international projects and teams.Fantastic holiday benefits including discounts, special offersMobile working, flexible working hours and working from abroad: We believe that work is something you do, not where you go. Our offer: TUI Way of Working Health and Wellbeing support in five key areas ‚Äì Health, Social, Community, Career and FinancialDevelopment and career opportunities: We offer a wide range of digital training and international career opportunities.Additional benefits relevant to the local market that you'll be based inAt TUI, we know people are as diverse as the destinations we send our customers to. We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit our Smile page Click hereIf you have any questions, please contact the Recruiter for this role via the contact information included in the advert.Please Note: These vacancies will be managed by an International Recruitment Team and therefore your application may be viewed by TUI colleagues outside your home country.#TUIJobs

job_description:
The team, position & mission:We are seeking an expert Informatica Cloud consultant with experience in Snowflake for an exciting and challenging international project. As a consultant, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and optimizing solutions based on the Informatica Cloud platform, with a specific focus on Snowflake technology. The position requires a demonstrable minimum English level of B2, as you will be working in an international environment.Your key areas of responsibility as Cloud Data Engineer:Collaborate with the project team to understand business and technical requirements and design solutions based on the Informatica Cloud platform, with a focus on Snowflake.Perform detailed data analysis and work on data source integration to ensure data quality and consistency.Configure and administer Snowflake environments, including designing and implementing schemas, tables, views, and data storage.Develop and maintain efficient and scalable data pipelines using tools and capabilities provided by Informatica Cloud.Conduct thorough testing of solution components and ensure quality and optimal performance.Provide guidance and technical support to the project team and end-users in the use of Informatica Cloud and Snowflake solutions.Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in the field of cloud computing and Snowflake, and apply that knowledge to projects.As an ideal candidate you have: Demonstrable experience as a Informatica Cloud consultant, with a specific focus on Snowflake. You should be able to showcase achievements and projects you have been involved in.Extensive knowledge in designing, implementing, and administering solutions based on the Cloud Computing platform.Experience in designing and optimizing schemas, tables, and queries in Snowflake.Strong knowledge of data integration technologies and building efficient data pipelines.Ability to analyze and understand business and technical requirements and translate them into practical and effective solutions.Strong communication skills and ability to work as part of a team in an international environment.Minimum high-level English proficiency, both written and verbal. Knowledge of French is a plus.What we offer you:Hybrid ways of working with access to our modern & collaborative offices in Madrid.We may work with tomorrow‚Äôs technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification.An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potentialA community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertiseAbout Orange Business:Orange Business is a leading network and digital integrator company with offices in 65 countries worldwide, and part of the Orange Group.Digital Services, a business line of Orange Business is a newly created division within Orange Business. In Europe the business line consists of approximately 1500 people distributed across 9 countries. We are digital natives, with innovation at the core of our business, which makes us a reliable partner close to our customers. Our joint mission is to help innovate, drive and lead them in their digital transformation challenges and business strategies in key digital domains, including Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace and Data & AI. As an agile and fast-moving digital business partner, the business line offers trusted end-to-end solutions and products that help businesses in a wide range of industries in the private and public sector transform their operations, enhance customer experience, and drive growth.With our digital expertise, we are a strategic partner of Orange Business objectives to be a leading network and digital integrator with our team as a key growth engine.The process: We screen applications on an ongoing basis, with the aim of conducting conversations and interviews as we receive them.Interested but feel that you don¬¥t match the criteria 100%? We encourage you to apply anyway! Your perfect match might be the next job we are announcing, so why not have a head start and apply now!Are you interested to read more about Orange Business? Visit our Website or follow our LinkedIn account.

job_description:
AgileEngine is a top-ranking provider of software solutions to Fortune 500, Global 500, and Future 50 companies. Listed on Inc. 5000 among the fastest-growing US companies, we are always open to talented software, UX, and data experts in the Americas, Europe, and Asia.If you like a challenging environment where you‚Äôre working with the best and are encouraged to learn and experiment daily, there‚Äôs no better place ‚Äî guaranteed! :)What you will doPerform analysis on existing relational and non-relational structures from various sources and business groups; Consolidate and Normalize the data and map to the destination data model; Identify new attributes, build technical requirements while mapping to the business context and usage of the attribute; Recommend incremental updates to data model accommodating additional data attributes and entities; Work with technical team implementing changes to data model; Evaluate the data for integrity and accuracy; feedback and work with business and technical teams to backfill gaps, if any; Modify existing bash scripts to configure existing data integration tools; Leverage in-depth master data management and PIM knowledge combined with technical data analysis to gain significant insights to maintain and improve the master data; Support content syndication to all retail partners & channels (Brand.com, Retailer.com, TR, 3rd party product feeds)including basic product content, retailer attributes, images, 360 spins, videos and enhanced/A+ content, etc; Identify, track and report new data attributes across brands; Summarize and report the work progress on daily basis. Must havesBachelor‚Äôs degree in technology / engineering with computer science or related field; 5+ years‚Äô experience in implementing database driven projects; 2-3 years of experience in architecting database, data warehousing or data migration; Must be extremely detail-oriented, deadline driven and have the ability to manage multiple projects at once; Tech savviness with an initiative to learn new software systems quickly; Strong problem-solving skills, analytical and critical-thinking skills to be able to proactively resolve issues and continuously improve results; Outstanding written and verbal communication skills required; Experience analyzing large sets of data to glean insights around product information and product data structure; Experience in working with relational databases and normalization of non-relational data; Ability to validate data integrity, completeness and relevance to the business requirements; Support technical and architectural changes in transforming product information while maintaining the data integrity and hierarchy structure; Exhibit curiosity and the desire to learn new tools and technologies; Tech savviness with an initiative to learn new software systems quickly; Thrive in a fast-past, dynamic environment and prioritize work and time effectively; Must be able to understand current and future state data models, recommend changes based on the outcome of analysis performed; Must be familiar with bash scripting; Must be able to work independently; Must have keen eye for details. Nice to havesStrong knowledge relational databases like Oracle, MySQL or Microsoft SQL Server; Must be familiar with bash scripting; Experience in working with data interchange formats like JSON and bulk data formats like CSV and Excel; Good written and verbal communication skills required; Experience in business analytics tools like PowerBI is preferred; Knowledge of InRiver and/or Adobe Creative Suite is a plus; Knowledge in eCommerce testing is added advantage. The benefits of joining usProfessional growth Accelerate your professional journey with mentorship, TechTalks, and personalized growth roadmaps.Competitive compensation We match your ever-growing skills, talent, and contributions with competitive USD-based compensation and budgets for education, fitness, and team activities.A selection of exciting projects Join projects with modern solutions development and top-tier clients that include Fortune 500 enterprises and leading product brands.Flextime Tailor your schedule for an optimal work-life balance, by having the options of working from home and going to the office ‚Äì whatever makes you the happiest and most productive.

CountrySpainJob FamilyTechnologyWe Show The World What People Want.Join GfK and help us shape tomorrow. As an NIQ company, we are the world's leading consumer intelligence firm, delivering the Full View‚Ñ¢ on consumer behavior. We work to enable manufacturers and retailers better understand what consumers really want. Our name has inspired trust for over 89 years because we take pride in discovering new pathways to sustainable growth for our clients, our people, and our planet.We are always looking for open-minded people who will grow with us, push boundaries, and pioneer disruptive methods in market research, data science, technology, and AI. If you share this passion to drive things forward and the integrity to insist on doing things the right way, we'll equip you to take your future into your own hands and play a leading role in our story.Job DescriptionAs a Data team we have to cover the three main specialties at the data field: Data Science, Data Analytics and Data Engineering. Today we have covered all the current needs in each field but we are looking for a boost in the Data Engineering part, looking to the future, by adding a person who provides us experience and knowledge about doing things in the right direction.Currently we are working on developing a solid data strategy inside Netquest, so we are looking for a team builder, someone who enjoys working with others and working with different people and departments, understanding their needs, sharing the decisions with the team and explaining the data solutions to the partners. You will report to the Head of Data.Key AccountabilitiesThe senior data engineer will look beyond their primary team scope and work toward harmonization and improvement of solutions across the CSG or even beyond.The Senior Data Engineer Is Also Accountable To Pass On Their Knowledge On To Other Engineers When The Opportunity Arises During The Course Of Their WorkDuring pair programming/ pair workWhen sought for adviceDuring code reviewsBy participating in Communities of PracticeThe senior data engineer brings together technical assets from different disciplines within their team and for encouraging a common solution approach between team members with different technical backgrounds.Knowledge And BackgroundThe ability to design and implement an entire data pipeline from scratchSolve with scale-out approaches and how to combine them in data pipelinesKnowledge about Data ArchitectureAwareness of Data GovernanceAn economic view on questions of operability of crafted data job_description:
WHO WE AREManychat is a leading Chat Marketing platform. We help businesses engage with their customers on Instagram, Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp, and Telegram. Manychat is a Meta Official Business Partner, backed by top investors, including Bessemer Venture Partners.With 140+ teammates across three global offices ‚Äî Barcelona, Yerevan, and Austin ‚Äî Manychat helps more than one million businesses worldwide interact with billions of customers in real-time at scale. No matter the use case ‚Äî generating leads, increasing engagement, providing 24/7 customer support, accepting payments, and beyond ‚Äî Manychat helps businesses improve their ROI and grow faster.WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FORWe are seeking a Large Language Model Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering team.The ideal candidate is enthusiastic about creating valuable and sought-after products not just for internal departments but for a broader audience.This role offers a unique opportunity to become a part of a startup-like initiative within the Manychat umbrella, where you can continuously learn, grow, and contribute to groundbreaking projects.WHAT YOU'LL DOAt Manychat's Data Engineering team, we strive for excellence in everything we do. While our day-to-day tasks are essential, we go beyond them to identify profitable opportunities and experiences.As part of the team, you will:Develop, implement, and support our AI Platform. AI Platform is an extension of our Data Platform designed to support all internal and external AI (LLM-based) features of Manychat, such as smart agents, helpers, detectors, and co-pilots.Design new AI features and support them with data.Design logging and live quality monitoring approaches.WHAT YOU'LL BRING Technical Knowledge:System design skills. Experience in designing complex, evolving IT systems with AI, ML, and analytical components.Proficiency in Python is essential (Python 3, data processing and analytics).Strong skills in SQL for data analysis and investigation.Knowledge of machine learning: classification, learning, metrics, overfitting.Basic knowledge of deep learning, LLM (transformers, attention mechanism), prompting.Familiarity with the BI Reporting tools.Familiarity with ML libraries in Python (for ML, NLP, and deep learning).Data-centric Experimentations: Understanding of data-driven hypothesis testing, the skill of proving arguments with data in a proper scientific way.Communication:English B1/B2 to participate in complex technical and mathematical discussions with colleagues.Ability to communicate with clients and colleagues in a supportive and polite manner.Knowledge of the Russian language will be a plus.Innovative Spirit: A drive to think out of the box, identify new opportunities, and contribute to the team's goal of being a profitable unit.Team Player: While individual contributions are valued, it's essential to collaborate and share knowledge within the team and the broader organization.WHAT WE OFFERWe care about your growth, well-being, and comfortProfessional development budget for relevant conference tickets, training programs, or courses.Flexible benefits plan to choose the perks that fit your needs.Health insurance including dentistry, psychology sessions, nutrition consultations, surgery, and travel assistance.Hybrid work format.Manychat is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We're committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We do not discriminate against qualified employees or applicants because of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual preference, sexual identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, or any other characteristic protected by local law or ordinance.This commitment is also reflected through our candidate experience. If you have individual needs that may require an accommodation during the interview process, please indicate this in your application. We will do our best to provide assistance throughout your interview process to ensure you're set up for success.
