DescriptionThe Data Engineer is responsible for developing, supporting and enhancing IT solutions in the Business Intelligence and Data Analytics area (from Data Acquisition, Ingestion and Data Modeling to Big Data, Analytics and Front end Tools).The person is expected to promptly assess business needs and engage in a constructive and positive dynamic with business partners.This position is expected to work closely with the business representatives and the rest of the Reporting and Data Analytics team to provide collaborative solutions and practices to maximize business value through technology.The position works closely with third party partners (offshore and nearshore) and is able to effectively collaborate in this set up.Reporting Line: Direct report to the Department ManagerResponsibilitiesSupports the transformation in Business Intelligence, being aware about new technologies and market trends. Focuses efforts on continuous improvement, identifying and seizing opportunities for synergy. Takes on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy and enthusiasm. Manages change requests on regional applications in adherence to regional change management processes and internal control requirements. Supports evolution of existing models and application maps. Analyzes, implements and follows up to deliver a technical solution aligned with the agreed business processes and following the established governance and applicable guidelines and policies. Figures out the processes necessary to get things done. Ensures that the solution is delivered on time, budget and quality. Promotes an adequate prioritization of activities. Build and maintain strong relationships with the business. Steps up to handle tough issues and readily takes action on challenges, without unnecessary planning. Position RequirementsUniversity degree in the field of computer science, engineering, administration and/or related field for which provides business advice. A Master‚Äôs degree is strongly preferred. 5+ years of related work experience. Minimum 2+ years of experience in active Big Data. Minimum 2+ years of experience in Data Analytics in AWS. Good knowledge on Orchestration of data pipelines (Airflow) and Containerization technologies (Docker and ECS). Experience on open source tools would be an advantage: Flink, Kafka, Spark and Hadoop. Experience in programming and databases would be an advantage: Python, Java and SQL. Experience in QlikView and QlikSense would be an advantage. Experience in Agile methodology would be an advantage. Excellent written, oral and interpersonal communication skills in English. Spanish, French, Arabic, German and/other languages used in the countries in which we operate would be an advantage. Pursues everything with energy, drive and the need to finish. Persist in accomplishing objectives despite obstacles and setbacks. Experienced with systems design and development from business requirements analysis to day-to-day management. Adapts quickly to changing resource requirements and enjoys multi-tasking applying knowledge of the organization (internal structures, processes and culture) to advance multiple objectives. Pushes him/herself and helps others achieve results. Partners with others to get work done. Works cooperatively with others across the organization to achieve shared objectives Works effectively with third parties (including offshore and nearshore service providers). Assist in prioritizing and executing tasks in a high-pressure environment. Ability to effectively work in a team-oriented and collaborative environment. Highly motivated and attentive to detail. Other InformationValue inclusion within the day to day responsibilities by respecting others‚Äô perspectives/ convictions, engaging others‚Äô opinions, creating a safe environment where people, ideas and opinions are valued within the team / ‚Äúinternal‚Äù customers and external partners. Respect and take into consideration diversity by valuing different world views, challenges and cultures that represent all walks of life and all backgrounds. Is sensitive to how people, cultures and organizations function. Deals comfortably with organizational politics. Steer through the organizational maze to get things done. Demonstrates positive thinking mindset, consistently identifying highlights. Shows a can-do attitude in good and bad times and acts as a role model in terms of ethics and self awareness. Ability to travel within the region for extended periods of time in a row (up to 40% in a year).

Bynder goes far beyond managing digital assets. Our digital asset management platform enables teams to conquer the chaos of proliferating content, touchpoints, and relationships in order to thrive.With powerful and intuitive solutions that embrace the way people want to work, and a richly integrated ecosystem, We are the brand ally that unifies and transforms the creation and sharing of assets, inspiring teams, delighting customers, and elevating businesses.Our 500+ employees, known as ‚ÄòByndies‚Äô, together constitute the world‚Äôs most extensive pool of digital asset management expertise. We enable more than 1.7M users across more than 3,700 organizations, including Spotify, Puma, Five Guys and Icelandair.Founded in 2013, we have eight offices around the globe, including the Netherlands, USA, Spain, UK, Australia and UAE. For more information, visit www.bynder.com.About the role:Our SAAS platform is seen as one of the best in the DAM industry and we attribute a big part of our success to the talented and hardworking engineers we have in our tech teams. We are becoming one of the fastest-growing scale-ups of The Netherlands and have big plans and the ambition to be the fastest-growing scale-up in the world. This is why we are looking for a Senior Data Engineer who would like to grow with us!As a Data Engineer at Bynder you will work closely with Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Software Engineers and DevOps Engineers, and anyone who uses data driven insights in their work. We are looking for someone who will help us develop data pipelines and build self-serve data tools for our internal stakeholders and customers. In this role you will see the direct impact of your work on our initiatives in improving the Bynder product, growing the customer base, and providing insights to our internal stakeholders.What will you do:Take a leading role in the improvement of our Data architecture.Develop, scale, maintain and deploy our data platform infrastructure in the cloud.Take a leading role in applying Data Lineage and Governance throughout the organisation.Advocate for Data Quality throughout the organisation.Support the entire Product & Engineering organisationOptimise the cost of managing and storing data.Develop custom ETL pipelines, detect anomalies, and create optimised aggregations for analysis and dash boarding.What will you bring as a Data Engineer:Minimum of 5+ years of Data Engineering experience and furthermore hands-on experienced in:Designing Data Platforms and taking architectural decisions, leading the way towards better data ecosystems.Applying Data Governance and Data Lineage best practices.Developing data flows for the processing of data at scale.Using industry standard data pipelining tools (Spark, Kafka).Working with AWS (S3, Glue, Athena, EMR, etc.).Using data/task orchestration tools (Airflow).Cloud computing-based data cloud solutions (Snowflake).Using infrastructure-as-code solutions (Terraform).Partnering with cross-functional teams of engineers, data scientists and devops in defining a modern data architecture.Exposure to data science is a plus. What will you bring as a colleague:A critical thinking mindset and the courage to speak your mind.A growth mindset and the determination to improve yourself and others.Great communication skills in English.What we offer:Challenging and inspiring work environmentFlat hierarchy where your voice will be truly heardOpportunity to initiate your own projectsAn experienced team which is ready to welcome you anytimeUnlimited vacation policyCompetitive monthly compensationApple gearDaily lunch Hybrid working environment: we have a great office in the city centre of Barcelona.Our Commitment:Bynder Love is the principle that guides the way we grow our teams, support our employees, and celebrate our differences. At Bynder we strive to create a culture that embraces every Byndie because differences in background, experience, and perspective make Bynder even better. At Bynder a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace is one where all employees, whatever their ethnicity, color, sex, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or physical and mental ability are valued and respected. Our commitment is for all Byndies to have the freedom to be their true authentic selves.Just as we are never finished innovating, Bynder‚Äôs commitment to being An Even Better Bynder is a constant, evolving commitment that includes education, listening, and action.

job_description:
Country: SpainWhat You Will Be DoingOpenbank is in the middle of a digital transformation, working in startup format and innovating in core banking product development from within. We want to convey a whole new digital experience to our customers and for that reason we need the most skilled professionals to come and join us. Currently we are looking for Big Data Developers to make the team even stronger.Responsibilities:Design and implement production big data environments using modern technologies. Build, validate, and optimize large-scale, big data solutions in heterogeneous data environments. Develop and manage ETLs in batch (Spark and Scala), and streaming (Apache Flink). To be successful in the role you must have3+ years of experience working with Scala, Spark, software design patterns, and TDD. Experience working with big data - Spark is a must - Hadoop, Hive, and/or Kafka would be a plus. Experience with different database structures, including SQL (Postgres, MySQL), and NOSQL (DynamoDB, DocumentDB, Redis, Elasticsearch). Experience and expertise across data integration and data management with high data volumes. Experience with Cloud ecosystems, AWS ecosystem (EMR, EC2, IAM, GLUE, ATHENA, S3, CloudFormation, LakeFormation, Redshift, DynamoDB, RDS, ECS & ECR) would be a great plus!Experience working in agile continuous integration/DevOps paradigm and tool set (Git, Jenkins, Sonar, Nexus, Jira, and Splunk). Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, or other STEM, and related fields, or equivalent work experience. Professional working proficiency in English. Nice to haveExperience with data warehousing, apache iceberg, and visualisation tools. Experience with NRT applications: Apache Flink, spark streaming. What do we offer?Joining a dynamic and agile environment, with plenty of opportunities to grow, and have impact!Working in a start-up mode with the support of Santander Group in a growing and expansion project. Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package. Collaboration in international projects with peers from all around the globe. Excellent work environment, social clubs, and frequent events. Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!We are the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group, and we are currently undergoing a technological transformation and international expansion process. In 2017, we kicked off our relaunch plans and have been continuously expanding and growing ever since, especially when it comes to technology. We work in a start-up format, using agile methodologies to take our customers' experience to the next level. In 2019, we launched in the Netherlands, Germany, and Portugal, recently followed by Argentina, with other countries currently in the pipeline.Our culture sets us apart from the rest; social and diversity clubs are part of our essence and day-to-day culture.Openbank is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered as equal without paying attention to gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, age, political orientation, union membership nor disability status. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.The personal data you provide as well as any data generated during the selection process are confidential and will be processed by Open Bank, S.A./ Open Digital Services, S.L. with registered office at Plaza de Santa B√°rbara 2, 28004 (Madrid), for the sole purpose of managing your participation in the selection processes and, where appropriate, to formalise your recruitment.Your data will be kept for the period required to carry out the selection processes that you take part in. Specifically, unless you indicate otherwise, your data will be kept for 18 months following your last application and will be deleted at the end of this period.You may exercise your rights of access, rectification, erasure, portability, restriction of processing and objection at any time by emailing openprivacy@gruposantander.com.For further information about your rights and data protection, please read the ODS/Openbank Privacy Policy applicable to this type of data processing here. Digitalents Graduate Program: Data Engineer At Sanofi, we advance the process from discovery to therapy with the power of digital. We don't settle for less, and we hope you don't either. Digitalents is your opportunity to make a real impact on the transformation of our business and people's lives across the globe.Why Digitalents? Digitalents is a two-year program that gives you the opportunity to complete different assignments while working with professionals from all over the world.You‚Äôll be part of a cohort, a community of talents, that will receive personalized guidance and support to help build the foundation for your future career. From empowering group learning and development experiences around the world to expert career advice, you'll work alongside and have exposure with senior leaders who are invested in your success.About the role:As a Data Engineer, you will have the opportunity to work on two assignments based in two separate locations: first year in Barcelona (Spain) and the second year in Toronto (Canada).Note: this role is a VIE opportunity and is only available to European citizens due to external regulations.Main responsibilities as Data Engineer:Apply expertise in data engineering to design, develop, and implement robust data solutions while collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand intricate data requirements Leverage modern data engineering tools to design, develop, and optimize data pipelines and data sets to ensure efficient data ingestion, transformation, delivery of data Gain proficiency in data integration technologies and ETL (extract, transform and load)/ELT processes. Implement tasks related to the life-cycle management of deployed data assets, including monitoring and troubleshooting Work closely with cloud technologies, with a focus on AWS, to support the development and maintenance of modern cloud-native data platforms Use data analysis, visualization, storytelling, and data technologies to scope, define and deliver data products helping AI-teams to create efficient models Work closely with cross-functional agile teams to contribute to the design and implementation of hybrid-cloud solutions with automated data pipelines Explore and develop foundational knowledge in data warehouse/lake solutions, data mesh architectures, and distributed processing technologies Build proficiency in SQL and relational/non-relational databases. Utilize programming languages such as Python, Shell scripting, and Scala/Java to optimize data engineering solutions Actively participate in the data engineering community, sharing insights, best practices, and innovative ideas to contribute to the growth of the industry Provide guidance and mentorship to junior team members, fostering a collaborative and growth-oriented team culture About You :Master‚Äôs Degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related discipline Strong knowledge and experience in data engineering concepts, ETL/ELT processes, and modern data engineering tools Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Shell scripting, and Scala/Java and familiarity with database systems, including SQL and NoSQL Knowledge of cloud and high-performance computer environments (e.g., AWS, GCP, Databricks, Apache Spark) Understanding of Agile concepts and principles, with the ability to work in a fast-paced agile environment Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts Business analysis, data visualization, and data storytelling skills Proficient in English; proficiency in Spanish would only be a plus Nice to have: Experience in production-ready software development Experience with DataOps (CI/CD) Knowledge of Tableau, Power BI, Plotly or similar Experience in life sciences and healthcare Experience in a complex global organization Please mind that only applications submitted in English will be considered. Target start date: April 2024Pursue progress, discover extraordinary Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn‚Äôt happen without people ‚Äì people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let‚Äôs be those people.At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!#digitalentsAt Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.

üöÄ Who are we? üöÄQuantum computing will change the world üöÄ, but with the current approaches, the true impact of conventional gate-based quantum computers lies at least a decade away. We, at Qilimanjaro Quantum Tech SL, aim to offer quantum advantage now, in a much shorter time frame, to solve industry-critical problems, specifically in optimization, machine learning and quantum simulation.Qilimanjaro Quantum Tech SL üèî is a full-stack start-up that spun off from the Barcelona Supercomputer Center (BSC), the University of Barcelona (UB), and the Institute of High-Energy Physics (IFAE). It started operations in 2020 with the support of international customer multi-year contracts.Our integrated hardware, software & application teams focus on the development of quantum analog solutions available on the cloud and on premise, based in superconducting qubit technology. It is Qilimanjaro‚Äôs goal to maximize quantum advantage with the current technology capabilities. For that, we concentrate our innovation on the co-design of next-generation app-specific analog quantum processors (QASIC) with high-quality qubits, which can bypass some of the demanding requirements of quantum error correction and can therefore be faster-to-market than digital solutions.What‚Äôs more, we have brought together a great and diverse team of scientists with extensive training, knowledge, and experience from international labs such as MIT, Caltech, Waterloo in Toronto, Stony Brook, ETH Zurich, and TU Delft.We are looking for highly motivated candidates to join our permanent staff. üí™üèªWhy don‚Äôt you join us? ü•áYou will:üöÄ Get the opportunity to build something amazing and unique, something that hasn't been done beforeüåç Work on ground-breaking projects and possibly solve massive challenges on a global scaleüíª Be at the intersection of research and industry, where biggest innovations happenüéØ Make an enormous impact in a dynamic scale-up rather than being a small cog in a big machineüí´ Work with super smart, knowledgeable and yet, very friendly people in Barcelona, one of the best cities in the world.The impact you will have üîùYour expertise in impedance matching, system modeling, and the development of system-level test plans will contribute to advancing quantum solutions. Your proficiency in requirements gathering and risk management, particularly DFMEA analysis, will enhance the reliability and safety of complex systems. Your ability to drive process improvements and ensure effective communication in cross-functional teams will play a crucial role. About UsHBX Group is a leading B2B ecosystem player in the TravelTech space, connecting and empowering businesses in the ever-evolving world of travel. We drive growth for our clients and partners while removing friction from the end-to-end travel experience. Our cloud-based technology platforms offer fast and reliable access to a unique portfolio of travel products & services, while rich data and intelligence seamlessly connect supply and demand worldwide.We have over more than 3,000 experts worldwide, including specialists on the ground who provide insights and support to boost trading even further, especially in the most hard-to-reach segments. This unique blend of technology, data and passionate people serves as a catalyst for all businesses aiming to unlock their full potential in the travel arena.HBX Group comprises four best-in-class B2B brands that meet the needs of its growing and diverse client base across 190+ global markets:‚Ä¢ Hotelbeds, who cater for the specific needs of hoteliers, tour operators, airlines and online travel agents‚Ä¢ Bedsonline, exclusively serving the retail travel segment‚Ä¢ Roiback, the HotelTech partner for independent hotels and chains seeking growth through direct channel solutions‚Ä¢ TravelStack, providing all products, services and solutions to businesses looking to enter into the lucrative travel arena.Job SummaryWe are looking for a talented and experienced Data Analyst to join our Analytics & Data Science team in the Fintech area. We believe in creating an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone can thrive and contribute to the team's success. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and experiences.In this role, you will work with the most advanced technologies in Data Science and Business Intelligence to support strategic projects that drive our e-commerce business forward. You will be responsible for data analysis, modelling, and visualizations, and work with stakeholders from all parts of the business to understand their problems and create solutions that are insightful and intuitive.We offer a hybrid or remote work model that allows you to work from multiple locations within Spain, including our HQ in Palma de Mallorca. Our analytics stack includes Snowflake for data warehousing, DBT and Airflow for data pipelines, Python for ML modelling, and Tableau for data visualizations.You don't need to be an expert in all of these technologies to apply, but you should be enthusiastic and willing to learn. We utilize agile working methods and give our team members responsibility from day one.Join our expanding team and help us put data insights at the heart of every commercial action. Are you up for the challenge?Job ResponsibilitiesAnalysis ‚Äì Link and analyze a range of datasets, understand our business logic, and generate insights around our business problems. This includes leveraging your knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis techniques.Build ‚Äì Contribute to our solutions by making changes to our dashboards or creating consumable data sources. This includes coding experience in relevant languages such as SQL and Python.Design & Development ‚Äì Use your knowledge of data architecture, UI/UX, and modeling to recommend and build solutions for our users. This includes ensuring accessibility and inclusivity in design, as well as familiarity with front-end development frameworks.Strategy / Business understanding - Collect requirements and iterate with the business to constantly improve our solutions. This includes the ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders across different levels of the organization.Business Support - Provide ongoing support for existing dashboards and reports, and ensure data quality and accuracy. This includes prioritizing user needs and troubleshooting issues in a timely manner.Required SkillsAt least three years of experience using SQL and one year using Python.Experience using Tableau, PowerBI or other business intelligence tools.Previous experience working with ETL/ELT tools such as DBT, Airflow, or other similar technologies.Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel or similar software.Demonstrated proactive attitude and enthusiasm for learning new technologies and their applications.Interest in both business and technical knowledge and the ability to integrate the two.Strong analytical skills and the ability to think critically.Effective communication skills, including the ability to collaborate and work well with others.A demonstrated ability to work effectively as a team player.A results-oriented mindset, with a focus on achieving goals and driving positive outcomes.A university degree or equivalent educational experience.Fluency in English.

job_title: Research Engineer Etl For Health Data
job_description:
Research Engineer ETL for Health Data at the BSC Life Sciences DepartmentResearch Engineer ETL for Health Data at the BSC Life Sciences DepartmentThe candidate willcoordinate the integration of Health Data from, and the required extraction software, a variety of sources into population databases . He/She willcollaborate closely with the INB/ELIXIR-ES unitand will alsodrive projects in the area in close collaboration with domain experts in healthcare settings at local and national levels . Female candidates are especially encouraged to apply.This position is in the context of the massive amount of health data available for research in the last years and the recent efforts at national and European levels to tap on those data to benefit patients. The use of such data should help scientists to better understand diseases and health conditions and provides new ways of identifying patients at higher risk. It also helps of preventing illness and of providing better treatments. This, in turn, improves health services' efficiency, optimising their resources where they matter the most. In the COVID-19 pandemic, using health data for research has enabled clinicians to quickly adapt to the new treatments available for critically ill patients and decision-makers to provide better urgent responses at different levels.This Plan Complementario is co-financed by the Ministerio de Ciencia e Innovaci√≥n and the Generalitat de Catalunya, with funds from the European Union NextGenerationEU (PRTR-C17.I1) The successful candidate will develop research involving:Under the direction of Prof Alfonso Valencia, the applicant will carry out the following activities:Coordinate the integration of Health Data and the required extraction software from a variety of sources into population databases.Manage and support users of the INB/ELIXIR-ES research-oriented resources, including computational equipment, databases, and software infrastructures.Develop, document, and maintain the processes for extracting and organizing Health-related data.Develop, document, and maintain software for the integration and biological data, following the guidelines of ELIXIR.Identify, adopt and impulse mechanisms for health data curation in close collaboration with domain experts in healthcare settings.BSc or MSc in bioinformatics, computational biology, or computer sciences with significant bioinformatics experienceAt least 2 years of experience in ETL processes for health research data.Experience in the communication with domain experts in the clinic around health research data management, acquisition and sharing.At least 3 years of professional experience in programming languages ecosystems such as C++, Perl, Python, PHP and/or Java.Experience working with Unix/Linux systems.Project management skills: reporting, documenting and planning.Ability to understand scientific literature, and software documentation.Competencies and skills: Communication, Teamwork and collaboration, Commitment, Proactivity, Integrity, Critical and Analytical thinking. Used to work under pressure under strict deadlines.Fluent in English (written and spoken). Spanish and/or Catalan are a plus.AdvantageousAdditional experience on one or more of the following will also be taken into account:Database design and management (SQL and NoSQL): MySQL/MariaDB, PostgreSQL, SQLite or similar; MongoDB, ElasticSearch, Cassandra or similar.Development, generation and use of software containers e.g. Docker, Singularity and/or Rkt, as well as their orchestration using docker-compose, Kubernetes, Ansible and/or similar technologies.Workflow managers such as Galaxy, Nextflow or similar.Research data management and most common bioinformatics data sources and formats.We OfferNumber of available positions: 1Starting date: 1 stof June 2023Working ConditionsFull-time 20-month contract. Attractive salaryMeasures to reconcile work and family life (maternity and paternity leave, flexible schedule working hours, 23 working days of paid holidays, and nine leave days for personal matters, among others).Stimulating, interdisciplinary research and a high-quality international scientific environment.IBEC ensures equal access to professional development opportunities irrespective of employment status, length at IBEC, or other factors. The IBEC's yearly training catalogue offers a wide range of technical and transferable skills training, including mobility grants and a Mentoring program for researchers.An induction program to facilitate incorporation at IBEC and additional support are provided for foreigners to obtain Visa-working permits and to install in Barcelona.Only those applications submitted before the deadline will be evaluated.Reference: PPCC-DATOS-CAT_BSCIf you have any further questions regarding your application or the application process, please get in touch with us at ******Principles Of The Selection ProcessIBEC is committed to the principles of the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers of the European Commission and the Open, Transparent, and Merit-based Recruitment principles (OTM-R).IBEC ¬¥s Commitment To Equal OpportunitiesOur strength and excellence as an international transdisciplinary Research Institute are based on diversity. Being an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to diversity and inclusion to support employees irrespective of their gender, nationality, religion, disabilities, age, sexual orientation, or cultural and socioeconomic background."Protection Of Personal DataIBEC guarantees that candidates' confidential data are processed per the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) requirements and Law 3/2018 on Data Protection.Personal data will be processed solely for the selection process.Who are we?The Institute for Bioengineering of Catalonia, IBEC is an interdisciplinary research center focused on Bioengineering and Nanomedicine based in Barcelona. IBEC is one of the top research institutions named Severo Ochoa Research Centre by the Ministry of Science, Universities, and Innovation, which recognizes excellence at the highest international level in research, training, human resources, outreach, and technology transfer.IBEC's mission is to develop international high-quality, interdisciplinary research that, while creating knowledge, contributes to a better quality of life, improves health, and creates wealth. A close link with key universities, reference hospitals, and corporations are assets that facilitate achieving the mission.IBEC was established in 2005 by the Generalitat de Catalunya (Autonomous Government of Catalonia), the University of Barcelona (UB), and the Technical University of Catalonia (UPC).IBEC is located within the Barcelona Science Park and manages 3.800 square meters of facilities, with an annual budget of 13 Mio‚Ç¨; 3.800 square meters of facilities; 21 research groups and a team of researchers and support services of 350 people from 30 different countries. www.ibecbarcelona.eu#J-18808-Ljbffr

Stacklok is an innovative software supply chain security startup founded by Kubernetes co-founder, Craig McLuckie and Sigstore founder, Luke Hinds. Our mission is to make it easier to securely develop software. With our deep expertise in open-source technologies and commitment to enhancing software security, we are seeking highly skilled and motivated individuals to join our team. This is a rare opportunity to join a startup at an early stage, and to be part of a team that is committed to building something truly innovative and impactful. Learn more about Stacklok's mission, virtues, and leadership, HERE.Elevator PitchStacklok just launched two new products, Trusty and Minder, that help developers and open source communities keep their software secure and choose safer dependencies. As we look to the future, it's critical that our SaaS systems perform to meet the needs and demands of our customers. In order to ensure that, we are seeking a Principal Data Engineer.As a Principal Data Engineer, you will have a leadership role owning Stacklok's Big Data system that will power our Software as a Service (SaaS) platform. You will optimize massive ingestion pipelines, architectures, and data models. Additionally, you will analyze and architect solutions to enhance data store performance, address state synchronization challenges, and streamline reconciliation processes, leveraging your expertise in Python and Go. The backend systems span both SQL (Postgres) and NoSQL (Elastic Search).Role Success: 6-12 Month Expectations Familiarization and Integration: Acclimatize to the team, understanding the workflows, processes, and ongoing projects. This includes getting to know team members, the company culture, and the specific tools and technologies used by Stacklok.Architectural Ownership: Take full ownership of the data infrastructure architecture, ensuring it is optimally designed for large-scale data handling and synchronization.Performance Optimization: Lead initiatives to significantly enhance the performance and efficiency of our SaaS platform, focusing on data-intensive operations.Data Reconciliation and Synchronization: Develop and maintain robust procedures for data reconciliation, ensuring data integrity and consistency.Innovative Solutions Development: Research and implement state-of-the-art solutions to meet evolving data management needs.Collaborative Leadership: Work closely with cross-functional teams to align the data architecture with the overall company objectives and customer requirements.In this Role, You will have the Opportunity to:Spearhead Architectural Innovations: Be the driving force behind architectural decisions, shaping how our SaaS platform evolves in handling data efficiently.Engage with Advanced Technologies: Work with cutting-edge tools and technologies in BigData, state synchronization gaining expertise in high-performance, scalable systems.Influence Key Data Strategies: Play a crucial role in defining the direction of our data strategies, significantly impacting how data is leveraged across the organization.Collaborate with Experts: Collaborate with top-tier professionals in the field, enhancing your knowledge and contributing to a culture of excellence.Drive a Performance-Centric Culture: Lead efforts to embed a performance-centric approach in all aspects of our data handling and processing.We know from experience that not ticking every box on the skills sections stops many from applying. Please apply regardless of your self-assessment -- we want to hear from you! We have seen engineers succeed with a diverse range of skills and experiences.Desired Skills & Experience Technical Proficiency: Expertise in Python and Go programming languages.Strong experience with large-scale data systems, including PostgreSQL and Elasticsearch.Familiarity with data store performance tuning and optimization.Data Management Skills:Proven track record in data synchronization, state management, and reconciliation within an enterprise grade commercial SaaS product.Hands-on experience with eventing systems and message brokers.Ability to architect and maintain scalable data pipelines.Systems Architecture:Experience in designing and owning the architecture of complex data systems.Capability to develop performance-centric solutions for SaaS platforms.Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills:Strong analytical skills with the ability to solve complex problems and provide practical solutions.Ability to work on large-scale, complex systems with a focus on performance and reliability.Leadership and Communication:Experience in mentoring junior engineers.Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.Ability to plan and execute complex engineering projects to a successful outcomeCollaboration and Teamwork:Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.Strong interpersonal skills and a proven track record of successful team collaboration.Why Join Us?At Stacklok, you will be a part of a culture that values open communication, collaboration, and innovation. We offer a competitive salary package and flexible work hours. If you're a self-motivated and result-driven individual with a passion for designing and building secure, scalable, distributed systems, and you want to be part of the most exciting startup in the secure supply chain space, come and join us!Stacklok Inc, is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law.

job_description:
If the expression ' Houston we have a problem ' gives you mixed feelings... Your place is with us!GMV, leader in commercial satellite control centers, is looking for a person to build, evolve and maintain a product for ingestion, storage, querying and visualization for satellite telemetry based on time series databases.We like to get to the point, so we're going to tell you what's not on the web. If you want to know more about GMV: www.gmv.com/en-es/about-gmv WHAT CHALLENGE ARE YOU GOING TO FACE? You will be part of a SCRUM team and the responsibilities will be: Optimize and maintain the division's products in the storage and persistence section of the data generated and especially those based on time series. Optimize the data models and queries used in the different products. Monitor and optimize the performance of solutions to ensure their availability and efficiencyWHAT DO WE NEED IN OUR TEAM?For this position, we are looking for engineering graduates with an interest in the world of software validation. We also value previous experience in: Database Management Systems: Comprehensive knowledge and practical experience with popular database management systems such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle and NoSQL databases such as MongoDB, and time series databases such as Influxdb, Timescale, QuestDB Database design and development: mastery of database design principles, data modeling and ability to translate business requirements into efficient database structures. Query Optimization: Ability to optimize database queries for better performance and understand the importance of indexing, normalization and denormalization.Knowledge or interest in: Management and optimization of time series databases. Optimization of low-level tasks or infrastructure. Problem solving and analytical thinking: ability to identify and solve database-related problems and possess a sharp analytical mindset. Communication and Collaboration: Excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, stakeholders and clients.WHAT DO WE OFFER?üíª Hybrid working model and 8 weeks per year of teleworking outside your usual geographical area.üïë Flexible start and finish times and intensive working hours on Fridays and summer.üöÄ Personalised career plan development, training and language learning support.üåç National and international mobility. Coming from another country? We offer you a relocation package.üí∞ Competitive remuneration with ongoing reviews, flexible remuneration and brand discounts.üí™Wellbeing programme: medical, dental and accident insurance, free fruit and coffee, training in physical, mental and financial health, and much more!In our selection processes, you will always have telephone and personal contact, in person or online, with our talent acquisition team. In addition, bank transfers and bank cards will never be requested. If you are contacted by any other process, please write to our team at privacy@gmv.com.‚ù§Ô∏èWe promote equal opportunities in recruitment and are committed to inclusion and diversity. WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR? JOIN If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact Laura Uribarren, in charge of this vacancy.Laura Uribarren

job_title: Software Engineer - Signal Processing and Machine Learning
job_description:
About Nanological:Nanological is a pioneering medical technology startup, a CSIC spin-off, at the forefront of diagnostic innovation. We are committed to transforming the rapid diagnosis of sepsis using cutting-edge technology, combining microfluidics, optics, and advanced data analysis. About the entityAXA is becoming a sustainable tech-led company and at AXA Group Operations we are one of the major catalysts for this transformation. We set the tone by triggering and empowering the evolution of our insurance business model through technology and innovation, driving its concrete implementation globally at speed, with a high quality of advisory and execution.We are present across 17 countries with committed, highly qualified teams. We use technology, data, sourcing, security, and investment allocation in a global way, but also achieve economies of scale and synergies when necessary. At AXA Group Operations, we want to be recognized in three fields of action:State-of-the-art Data Technology to drive customer experience.State-of-the-art Procurement & Sourcing to drive efficiency and better manage risks.High-Performing Global Team for stronger partnerships with AXA entitiesJob position pitchYou have a lot of creativity, technical skills, and a strong focus on innovation and experimentation? You are in the right place.As a R&D Software engineer you will be playing a crucial role in the early stages of product development, leading the discovery and prototyping phases on innovative solutions to revolutionize insurance.Where will you be in the organization?The divisionWithin AXA Group Operations, Group Emerging Technology and Data (GETD) defines the Group's data maturity ambitions; builds and manages the community; leads research and expertise; assists the less data mature entities; identifies cutting edge technologies and develops disruptive applications for the entities; creates use cases on specific technologies with the entities.The department / teamIn GETD, you will join the Computable Contracts team.Within GETD, we have developed a solution to make insurance contracts computable. Computable contracts are the interface of law and technology, they operate standardized digital model that can be easily readable by everyone, from legal experts to regular customers ‚Äì and computers. It‚Äôs a way to express the terms of contracts directly in machine executable code: contract as a code is the basis for automation, standardization and simplification which drive positive impacts both in terms of customer experience (transparency and personalization) and operations efficiency. Computable contracts are a game changer for the insurance industry and for AXA. This strategic initiative is supported at the ExCom level. If you are searching for an impactful job, have an entrepreneurial mindset and like challenges, join us in this new business we are launching!About the jobJob purposeThe role of a R&D Developer is to perform discovery of new initiatives to improve the existing capabilities of the Computable Contract products, or add new capabilities through: Research: In collaboration with the product owner and the UX/research designer he will research and gather information to understand the problem space and identify potential solutions. This phase often involves a lot of exploration and analysis to define the scope and requirements of the project.Prototyping: He creates initial versions of a product or feature: the Proof of Concept, crucial for testing ideas and concepts. Proof of Concepts help in validating assumptions, gathering user feedback, and iterating quickly before moving into full-scale development.He is responsible for the transfer of the learnings for the delivery phase of the validated solution. He may take ownership of the delivery, or start working on a different discovery initiative, once the transfer of knowledge is complete.Main missions & responsibilities Idea Generation and Exploration: Generating innovative ideas and exploring new technologies or methods that could be applied to the project. Feasibility Studies: Conducting feasibility studies to assess the practicality and potential impact of the proposed ideas. This includes evaluating technical feasibility, cost implications, and overall alignment with business objectives. Prototyping: Developing prototypes to test concepts and ideas. This involves creating early models of a product or feature to demonstrate its functionality and potential. Prototyping is often iterative, requiring multiple versions to refine the concept. Technical Problem-Solving: Solving complex technical challenges that arise during the development of prototypes. This requires a deep understanding of the technology stack and the ability to think creatively to find solutions.User Testing and Feedback Gathering: In partnership with the UX designer and the Product Owner, conducting user testing sessions and gathering feedback to validate assumptions and identify areas for improvement. Understanding user perspectives is crucial for refining prototypes.Innovation and Continuous Learning: Continuously learning and experimenting with new approaches and technologies to drive innovation. Staying ahead of the curve is essential in a fast-paced tech environment. This involves staying up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies. Collaboration with Cross-functional Teams: Collaborating with product managers, designers, and other developers to ensure that the prototype aligns with user needs and business goals. This involves regular communication and coordination with different teams.Transitioning Prototypes to Production: Working with development teams to transition successful prototypes into production-ready products or features. This may involve redesigning or re-engineering aspects of the prototype for scalability and reliability, and technical documentation.Expected skills & experienceWe are looking for someone with the following experience and skills:Experience : At least 5 years of experience in development.Technical skillsExperience on the following domains/technologies is mandatory: backend development using Node.js/Python/Go in a cloud environment with proficient in operations (DevOps), frontend development frameworks (such as VueJS)Very good knowledge in software development and several years of experience in Javascript.Well versed in REST, Clean Code, DevOps and Continuous IntegrationGood knowledge of Docker, CI/CD and TestingExperience in using automated tests (Jest and Cypress)Experience with various database systems (MariaDB, Redis, influxDB, graph DBs ‚Ä¶)Good knowledge of the security environment (OpenID, OAuth, SAML)Experience with cloud technologies such as Docker and Openshift is a plusYou are open to new ideas, enjoy and are interested in communicating and enjoy working in agile teams.Soft skills / transversal skillsExcellent written and verbal English communication. You will do most of your writing in English. Speaking will be mainly in English (mandatory).
